title: Pixel 3a video seems to take crazy amounts of storage
content:
I recorded a video earlier on my Pixel 3a with settings of 30fps, video-stabilisation on, 4K off and using the H.265 codec.

I recorded about 6 minutes 30 seconds and the resulting video file is 0.91GB (922.7MB)!

I then did two test videos, each 10 seconds, and using H.265 it came to 24.8MB and with H.264 gives a file-size of 28.8MB.

Nearly 30MB every 10 seconds seems crazy to me. Anyone else get this on their Pixel 3a? Is this a bug in the Google Camera app? Or is this normal?

(In contrast, if I take a regular photo, each file is around 1.5MB each, on average, which is totally normal to me.)

Thanks!
